comment.author: 35547288@N00
comment._content: These are wonderful.  Thank you, Library of Congress!!!

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Harriot Eaton Stanton Blatch (January 20, 1856 – November 20, 1940) was a notable American writer and suffragist and the daughter of pioneering women's rights activist Elizabeth Cady Stanton. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harriot_Eaton_Stanton_Blatch

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Richard Arthur Norton:

Thanks for the information on Mrs. Blatch. Based on other images in the Prints and Photographs Division's collection and the names noted on this negative, we can also identify the remaining women pictured here as, from L to R: Susan Fitzgerald, Emma Bugby, Maggie Murphy and Harriot Stanton Blatch. We will expand the description when we update this record.

comment._content: Other LOC photos of Harriot Blatch and the New York suffrage parade: www.flickr.com/search/?q=Blatch&w=8623220@N02
